title: Law establishing Rwanda Archives and Library Services Authority(RALSA) and Determining its Mission, Organisation and Functioning
title_en: Law establishing Rwanda Archives and Library Services Authority(RALSA) and Determining its Mission, Organisation and Functioning

provisions.title: Article One – Purpose of this Law
provisions.content: This Law establishes Rwanda Archives and Library Services Authority, abbreviated as “RALSA”. It also determines its mission, organisation and functioning. RALSA shall have legal personality, administrative and financial autonomy and shall be governed in accordance with laws governing public institutions.

provisions.title: Article 2 – Definition of terms
provisions.content: For the purpose of this Law, the following terms shall have the following meanings: 1° Library: any public or private place with a collection of documents or other information medium that are kept physically or electronically for reading purpose; 2° Rwanda Archives and Library Services Authority: a national institution merging the national archives and library services; 3° National Library: a department established by Government to serve as legal depository of all publications produced about or within the country; 4° National Archives: a department established for collecting, keeping and preserving documentary resources that are nationally significant and have historical value; 5° Library services: services related to the borrowing and return of documents, subscription to have access to reading and those related to reading that are provided within the National Library and libraries.

provisions.title: Article 3 – Head office of RALSA
provisions.content: The head office of RALSA is located Kigali, the Capital of the Republic of Rwanda. It may be transferred elsewhere in the Republic of Rwanda if considered necessary. In order to fulfil its mission, RALSA may have branches elsewhere in the country if considered necessary, upon approval by a Prime Minister's Order.

provisions.title: Article 4 – Mission of RALSA
provisions.content: RALSA shall have the following mission: 1° to implement Government policy on archives and library services; 2° to advise the Government on policies and strategies related to the management of archives and library services; 3° to plan the program designed to develop and promote the functioning of the Archives and Library Services Authority; 4° to mobilize and raise funds for Rwanda Archives and Library Services Authority; 5° to conduct research in the area of archives and library services and disseminate findings thereof to the Government and the public; 6° subject to classified documents, to acquire, process and preserve public and private records and make them accessible to the public; 7° to issue instructions relating to the management of records to be retained and disposed of and monitor their implementation; 8° to contribute to the promotion of the reading and writing culture; 9° to develop and avail national standards for all types of libraries including at least standards relating to infrastructure, libraries and technical services; 10° to assign, upon request, a number to documents for publication; 11° to monitor and receive copies of works in case such works relate to the country; 12° to engage in partnerships with agencies and organizations in charge of archives and library services that are based inside and outside Rwanda and with other agencies and organizations that can help RALSA fulfil its mission. An Order of the Minister in charge of archives and library services shall determine procedures for preservation of documents in archives and libraries and it shall also determine the list of copies of works to be submitted to RALSA.

provisions.chapter: Chapter III – Supervising authority of RALSA and its category
provisions.title: Article 5 – Supervising authority of RALSA and its category
provisions.content: A Prime Minister's Order shall determine the supervising authority of RALSA and its category. There shall be concluded between the supervising authority of RALSA and its decision-making organ a performance contract indicating powers, rights and obligations of each party in order for RALSA to fulfil its mission. Such a contract shall be valid for a period equal to the term of office of the members of the Board of Directors.

provisions.chapter: Chapter IV – Organization and functioning of RALSA
provisions.title: Article 6 – Management organs of RALSA
provisions.content: RALSA shall be comprised of the two (2) following management organs: 1° the Board of Directors; 2° the General Directorate. A Prime Minister's Order may establish other relevant organs in order for RALSA to fulfil its mission.

provisions.chapter: Chapter IV – Organization and functioning of RALSA
provisions.title: Article 7 – Board of Directors
provisions.content: The Board of Directors of RALSA shall be its governing and decision-making organ. The competence, responsibilities, functioning and term of office of its members shall be determined by a Prime Minister's Order. A Presidential Order shall appoint members of the Board of Directors including the Chairperson and the Deputy Chairperson. Members of the Board of Directors shall be selected on the basis of their competence and expertise. At least thirty per cent (30%) of the members of the Board of Directors shall be female.

provisions.chapter: Chapter IV – Organization and functioning of RALSA
provisions.title: Article 8 – Sitting allowances for members of the Board of Directors
provisions.content: Members of the Board of Directors present in the meetings of the Board of Directors shall be entitled to sitting allowances determined by a Presidential Order.

provisions.chapter: Chapter IV – Organization and functioning of RALSA
provisions.title: Article 9 – Incompatibilities with membership of the Board of Directors
provisions.content: Members of the Board of Directors shall not be allowed to perform any remunerated activity within RALSA. They shall also not be allowed neither individually nor companies in which they hold shares, to bid for tenders of RALSA.

provisions.chapter: Chapter IV – Organization and functioning of RALSA
provisions.title: Article 10 – Composition of the General Directorate of RALSA
provisions.content: Members of the General Directorate of RALSA shall be appointed by a Presidential Order. The competence, responsibilities and modalities for fulfilling the duties of the members of the General Directorate of RALSA shall be determined by a Prime Minister's Order.

provisions.chapter: Chapter IV – Organization and functioning of RALSA
provisions.title: Article 11 – Statutes governing staff of RALSA and benefits of members of the General Directorate and staff members of RALSA
provisions.content: The staff of RALSA shall be governed by the General Statutes for Public Service. Benefits allocated to the members of the General Directorate and staff members of RALSA shall be determined in accordance with legal provisions governing benefits to employees of public institutions.

provisions.chapter: Chapter IV – Organization and functioning of RALSA
provisions.title: Article 12 – Organization, functioning and responsibilities of RALSA organs
provisions.content: The organization, functioning and responsibilities of RALSA organs shall be determined by a Prime Minister's Order.

provisions.title: Article 13 – Property of RALSA and its sources
provisions.content: The Property of RALSA shall be comprised of movables and immovables. The property of RALSA shall come from the following sources: 1° State budget allocations; 2° State or partners' grants; 3° income from services rendered; 4° proceeds from its property; 5° donations and bequests; 6° loans granted to RALSA and approved by the Minister in charge of finance.

provisions.title: Article 14 – Use, management and audit of the property
provisions.content: The use, management and audit of the property of RALSA shall be carried out in accordance with relevant legal provisions. RALSA internal audit service shall submit a report to the Board of Directors with a copy to the head of the General Directorate of RALSA.

provisions.title: Article 15 – Approval and management of the budget of RALSA
provisions.content: The budget of RALSA shall be approved and managed in accordance with relevant legal provisions.

provisions.title: Article 16 – Annual financial report
provisions.content: Within three (3) months following the closure of the financial year, the head of the General Directorate of RALSA shall submit the annual financial report to the supervising authority of RALSA after its approval by the Board of Directors in accordance with laws governing the management of State finance and property.

provisions.title: Article 17 – Drafting, consideration and adoption of this Law
provisions.content: This Law was drafted in English, considered and adopted in Kinyarwanda.

provisions.title: Article 18 – Repealing provision
provisions.content: All prior legal provisions contrary to this Law are hereby repealed.

provisions.title: Article 19 – Commencement
provisions.content: This Law shall come into force on the date of its publication in the Official Gazette of the Republic of Rwanda.
